summary: Website project for mobile phone spare parts: build a full e-commerce store with cart and Stripe checkout.
architectural_notes: Payments via Stripe are required for checkout.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimalist spare parts store logo, monochrome with warm accent (logo-spareparts.dim_512x512.png)
- Wide hero banner featuring abstract mobile repair/spare parts shapes, clean modern style (hero-banner.dim_1600x600.png)
- Set of 6 simple line icons for categories (battery, screen, camera, charging port, speaker, flex cable), consistent stroke style (category-icons-set.dim_1024x1024.png)
- Favicon based on logo mark, simplified (favicon-mark.dim_128x128.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core storefront user experience for a mobile phone spare parts store: a responsive home page, product listing (search + filters), product details page, and persistent shopping cart.
Add an admin UI to manage products (create, edit, archive) from the browser.
Implement Stripe Checkout flow for placing orders: collect cart details, create a Stripe Checkout Session, redirect to Stripe, and show success/cancel pages on return.
Record orders in the backend and provide an order confirmation view: store order items, totals, status, and Stripe session/payment identifiers; show a confirmation summary after payment success.
Add Internet Identity sign-in support and tie admin permissions (and optionally order history) to authenticated principals.
Create a coherent visual theme and apply it consistently across pages (typography, spacing, components, and mobile-first layout). Avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.
Add basic commerce UX essentials: currency display, stock/availability messaging, and helpful empty/error states for loading, no results, and checkout failures.
Add static asset handling for generated brand images and use them in the UI (logo, favicon, and a simple hero/banner image).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a mobile phone spare parts e-commerce website with product listings, shopping cart, and Stripe-powered checkout.
Implement backend product catalog storage and APIs to support the storefront: list products, get product by ID, and (admin-only) create/update/archive products.

projectName: Mobile phone spare parts e-commerce store with cart and Stripe checkout
